intro: Cremanthodium fletcheri, commonly known as Fletcher's cremanthodium, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in a dense, spherical shape. It thrives in rocky soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
